arabicText: وَلَئِنْ أَتَيْتَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ بِكُلِّ ءَايَةٍۢ مَّا تَبِعُوا۟ قِبْلَتَكَ ۚ وَمَآ أَنتَ بِتَابِعٍۢ قِبْلَتَهُمْ ۚ وَمَا بَعْضُهُم بِتَابِعٍۢ قِبْلَةَ بَعْضٍۢ ۚ وَلَئِنِ ٱتَّبَعْتَ أَهْوَآءَهُم مِّنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جَآءَكَ مِنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ ۙ إِنَّكَ إِذًۭا لَّمِنَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 even	 if	 you	 were	 to	 bring	 all	 the	 signs	 to	 the	 People	 given	 the	 Book(s),	 they	 would	 not	
follow	your	qiblah;	nor	should	you	 follow	 their	qiblah;	nor	do	 they	 follow	each	others	qiblah;	
and	 were	 you	 (the	 followers	 of	 this	 Prophet)	 to	 follow	 their	 desires	 after	 having	 received	
knowledge,	you	would	then	surely	be	unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	tum	un	kitābiyoñ	ke	pās	har	nishāni	lekar	āao	woh	tumhāre	qibla	ki	pairwi	na	kareñge	
aur	na	tum	unke	qible	ki	pairwi	karo	aur	woh	āpas	meiñ	bhi	ek	doosre	ke	qibla	ke	tābe'	nahi	aur	
(aey	sun	ne	wāle	kase	bāshad	)	agar	 tu	unki	khuwahishoñ	par	chala	bād	iske	ke	 tujhe	ilm	mil	
chuka	to	us	waqt	tu	zaroor	sitamghār	(zālim)	hoga

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ يَعْرِفُونَهُۥ كَمَا يَعْرِفُونَ أَبْنَآءَهُمْ ۖ وَإِنَّ فَرِيقًۭا مِّنْهُمْ لَيَكْتُمُونَ ٱلْحَقَّ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	 to	 whom	 We	 gave	 the	 Book(s)	
recognise	 the	 Prophet	 (Muhammad -
peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him)	 as	men	
(or	 they)	 recognise	 their	 own	 sons;	 and	
undoubtedly	 a	 group	 among	 them	
purposely	conceals	the	truth.
romanUrduTranslationText:
inheiñ	 hum	 ne	 kitāb	 ‘ata	 farmāyi	 woh	 is	
Nabi	 ko	 aisa	 pahchānte	 haiñ	 jaise	 ādmi	
apne	 betoñ	 ko	 pehchānta	 hai	 aur	 beshak	
un	 meiñ	 ek	 giroh	 jān	 boojh	 kar	 haq	
chupāte	haiñ

arabicText: ٱلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكَ ۖ فَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُمْتَرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
This	 is	 the	 Truth	 from	 your	 Lord,	
therefore	(O	those	who	listen)	beware	- do	
not	be	in	doubt..
romanUrduTranslationText:
(Aey	sun	ne	wāle)	yeh	haq	hai	tere	rab	ki	
taraf	 se	 (ya	 haq	 wohi	 hai	 jo	 tere	 Rab	 ki	
taraf	se	ho	)

arabicText: وَلِكُلٍّۢ وِجْهَةٌ هُوَ مُوَلِّيهَا ۖ فَٱسْتَبِقُوا۟ ٱلْخَيْرَٰتِ ۚ أَيْنَ مَا تَكُونُوا۟ يَأْتِ بِكُمُ ٱللَّهُ جَمِيعًا ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَىْءٍۢ قَدِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	 each	 one	 has	 a	 direction	 towards	
which	 he	 inclines,	 therefore	 strive	 to	
surpass	 others	 in	 good	 deeds;	 Allah will	
bring	you	all	together,	wherever	you	may	
be;	indeed	Allah may	do	as	He	wills
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	khabar-dār	tu	shak	na	karna	ur	har	ek	
ke	liye	tawajjo	ki	ek	samt	hai	ke	woh	usi	ki	
taraf	 muñh	 karta	 hai	 to	 yeh	 chāho	 ke	
nekiyoñ	 meiñ	 auroñ	 se	 āge	 nikal	 jāyeñ
tum	kaheeñ	ho	Allah	tum	sab	ko	ikhat-tha	
le	āye	ga	beshak	Allah	jo	chāhe	kare.

arabicText: وَمِنْ حَيْثُ خَرَجْتَ فَوَلِّ وَجْهَكَ شَطْرَ ٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْحَرَامِ ۖ وَإِنَّهُۥ لَلْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكَ ۗ وَمَا ٱللَّهُ بِغَـٰفِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 wherever	 you	 come	 from, turn	 your	
face	 towards	 the	 Sacred	 Masjid;	 and	
indeed	it	is	the	truth	from	your	Lord;	and	
Allah is	not	unaware	of	your	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	 jahāñ	 se	 āao	 apna	 muñh	 Masjid-eHarām ki	 taraf	 karo	 aur	 woh	 zaroor	
tumhāre	Rab	ki	 taraf	se	haq	hai	aur	Allah	
tumhāre	kāmoñ	se	ghāfil	nahi.

arabicText: وَمِنْ حَيْثُ خَرَجْتَ فَوَلِّ وَجْهَكَ شَطْرَ ٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْحَرَامِ ۚ وَحَيْثُ مَا كُنتُمْ فَوَلُّوا۟ وُجُوهَكُمْ شَطْرَهُۥ لِئَلَّا يَكُونَ لِلنَّاسِ عَلَيْكُمْ حُجَّةٌ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ مِنْهُمْ فَلَا تَخْشَوْهُمْ وَٱخْشَوْنِى وَلِأُتِمَّ نِعْمَتِى عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 O	 dear	 Prophet	(Muhammad - peace	
and	 blessings	 be	upon	 him)	wherever	 you	
come	 from,	 turn	 your	 face	 towards	 the	
Sacred	Masjid;	and	wherever	you	may	be,	
O	 Muslims,	 turn	 your	 faces	 towards	 it	
only,	 so	 that	 people	 may	 not	 have	 an	
argument	 against	 you	 - except	 those	
among	 them	 who	 do	 injustice;	 therefore	
do	not	fear	them,	and	fear	Me;	and	this	is	
in	order	that	I	complete	My	favour	upon	you	and	that	you	may	attain	guidance.	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	aey	Mehboob!	Tum	jahāñ	se	āao	apna	
muñh	Masjid-e-Harām	 ki	 taraf	 	 karo.	 Aur	
aey	 Musalmanoñ!	 Tum	 jahāñ	 kahiñ	 ho	
apna	muñh	usi	taraf	karo	ke	logoñ	ko	tum	
par	 koi	 hujjat	 na	 rahe	 magar	 jo	 un	 meiñ	
na-insāfi	kareñ	to	unse	na	daro	aur	mujh	se	daro	aur	yeh	is	liye	hai	ke	maiñ	apni	ne'mat	tum	par	
poori	karooñ	aur	kisi	tarah	tum	hidāyat	pāo

arabicText: كَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا فِيكُمْ رَسُولًۭا مِّنكُمْ يَتْلُوا۟ عَلَيْكُمْ ءَايَـٰتِنَا وَيُزَكِّيكُمْ وَيُعَلِّمُكُمُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْحِكْمَةَ وَيُعَلِّمُكُم مَّا لَمْ تَكُونُوا۟ تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	 way	 We	 have	 sent	 to	 you	 a	 Noble	 Messenger	 from	 among	 you,	 who	 recites	 to	 you	 Our	
verses	and	purifies	you,	and	teaches	you	the	Book	and	sound	wisdom*,	and	teaches	you	what	
you	 did	 not	 know.	(The	 traditions	 /	 sayings	 of	 the	Holy	 Prophet	- peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	
him).		-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jaise	hum	ne	tum	meiñ	bheja	ek	Rasool	tum	meiñ	se	ke	tum	par	hamāri	āyateiñ	tilāwat	farmāta	
hai	 aur	 tumheiñ	 pāk	 karta	 aur	 Kitāb	 aur	 pukhta	 ilm	 sikhāta	 hai	 aur	 tumheiñ	 woh	 ta'leem	
farmāta	hai	jiska	tumheiñ	ilm	na	tha

arabicText: فَٱذْكُرُونِىٓ أَذْكُرْكُمْ وَٱشْكُرُوا۟ لِى وَلَا تَكْفُرُونِ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	remember	Me,	 I	will	cause	you	to	be	spoken	of	and	acknowledge	My	rights,	and	do	
not	be	ungrateful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	meri	 yād	 karo	maiñ	 tumhāra	 charcha	 karoñga	 aur	mera	 haq	māno	 aur	meri	 na-shukri	 na	
kar

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ ٱسْتَعِينُوا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَٱلصَّلَوٰةِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
O	 People	 who	 Believe!	 Seek	 help	 from	 patience	 and	 prayer;	 indeed	 Allah is	 with	 those	 who	
patiently	endure.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aey	Imān	wālo	sabr	aur	Namāz	se	madad	chāho	beshak	Allah	sābiroñ	ke	sāth	hai	.

arabicText: وَلَا تَقُولُوا۟ لِمَن يُقْتَلُ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ أَمْوَٰتٌۢ ۚ بَلْ أَحْيَآءٌۭ وَلَـٰكِن لَّا تَشْعُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	do	not	utter	regarding	those	who	are	
slain	 in	 Allah's	 cause	 as	 “dead”;	 in	 fact	
they	 are	 alive,	 but	 it	 is	 you	 who	 are	
unaware.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 jo	 Khuda	 ki	 rāh	 meiñ	 māre	 jāyeiñ	
unheiñ	 murda	 na	 kaho	 balke	 woh	 zinda	
haiñ	hān tumheiñ	khabar	nahi

arabicText: وَلَنَبْلُوَنَّكُم بِشَىْءٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلْخَوْفِ وَٱلْجُوعِ وَنَقْصٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلْأَمْوَٰلِ وَٱلْأَنفُسِ وَٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ ۗ وَبَشِّرِ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 We	 will	 surely	 test	 you	 with	 some	
fear	 and	 hunger,	 and	 with	 paucity	 of	
wealth	and	lives	and	crops;	and	give	glad	
tidings	to	those	who	patiently	endure.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zaroor	ham	tumheiñ	āzmāyeñge	kuch	
dar	 aur	 bhook	 se	 aur	 kuch	 māloñ	 aur	
jānoñ	 aur	 phaloñ	 ki	 kami	 se	 aur	 khush	
khabri	suna	un	sabr	wāloñ	ko

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَآ أَصَـٰبَتْهُم مُّصِيبَةٌۭ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا لِلَّهِ وَإِنَّآ إِلَيْهِ رَٰجِعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	 who	 say	 when	 calamity	 befalls	
them,	 “Indeed	 we	 belong	 to	 Allah and	
indeed	it	is	to	Him	we	are	to	return.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Ke	jab	 un	 par	 koi	musibat	 pade	 to	 kaheñ	
ham	Allah	 ke	māl	 haiñ	aur	 ham	 ko	 usi	 ki	
taraf	phirna

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ عَلَيْهِمْ صَلَوَٰتٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ وَرَحْمَةٌۭ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
These	are	 the	people	upon	whom	are	 the	
blessings	from	their	Lord,	and	mercy;	and	
it	is	they	who	are	on	guidance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	 log	 haiñ	 jin	 par	 unke	 Rab	 ki	
Duroodeiñ	 haiñ	 aur	 rahmat	 yahi	 log	 rāh	
par	haiñ.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلصَّفَا وَٱلْمَرْوَةَ مِن شَعَآئِرِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ فَمَنْ حَجَّ ٱلْبَيْتَ أَوِ ٱعْتَمَرَ فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَيْهِ أَن يَطَّوَّفَ بِهِمَا ۚ وَمَن تَطَوَّعَ خَيْرًۭا فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ شَاكِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
Undoubtedly	 Safa	 and	 Marwah	 *	 are	
among	the	symbols	of	Allah;	so	there	is	no	
sin	on	him,	for	whoever	performs	the	Hajj	
(pilgrimage)	of	this	House	(of	Allah)	or	the	
Umrah	(lesser	pilgrimage),	to	go	back	and	
forth	 between	 them;	 and	 whoever	 does	
good	of	his	own	accord,	 then	(know	 that)	
indeed	 Allah is	 Most	 Appreciative	
(rewards	 virtue),	the	 All	 Knowing.	(These	
are	2	hillocks	near	the	Holy	Ka’aba)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Beshak	 Safā	 aur Marwah Allah	 ki	
nishānoñ	 se	 haiñ	 to	 jo	 is ghar	 ka	 haj	 ya	
Umrah	kare	us	par	kuch	gunāh	nahi	ke	in	
donoñ	 ke	 phere	 kare	 aur	jo	 koi	 bhali	 bāt	
apni	 taraf	 se	 kare	 to	 Allah	 neki	 ka	 sila	
dene	wāla	khabar-dār	hai	.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَكْتُمُونَ مَآ أَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ وَٱلْهُدَىٰ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا بَيَّنَّـٰهُ لِلنَّاسِ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ۙ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَلْعَنُهُمُ ٱللَّهُ وَيَلْعَنُهُمُ ٱللَّـٰعِنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 those	 who	 hide	 the	 clear	 proofs	
and	 the	 guidance	 which	 We	 sent	 down,	
after	We	made	it	clear	 to	mankind	in	 the	
Book	- upon	them	is	the	curse	of	Allah and	
the	curse	of	those	who	curse
romanUrduTranslationText:
Beshak	woh	jo	hamāri	utāri	huwi	raushan	
bātoñ	 aur	 hidāyat	 ko	 chupāte	 haiñ	 b'ād	
iske	ke	logoñ	ke	liye	ham	usey	kitāb	meiñ	
wāzeh	 farma	chuke	un	par	Allah	ki	la'nat	
hai	aur	la'nat	karne	wāloñ	ki	la'nat

arabicText: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ تَابُوا۟ وَأَصْلَحُوا۟ وَبَيَّنُوا۟ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَتُوبُ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ وَأَنَا ٱلتَّوَّابُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
englishTranslationText:
Except	 those	 who	 repent	 and	 do	 reform	 and	 disclose	 (the	 truth)	 - so	 I	 will	 accept	 their	
repentance;	and	I	only	am	the	Most	Acceptor	of	Repentance,	the	Most	Merciful
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	woh	jo	tauba	kareiñ	aur	sawāreiñ (Islāh	kareñ) aur	zāhir	kardeiñ	to	maiñ	hi	hooñ	bada	
tauba	qabool	farmāne	wāla	maherbān

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ وَمَاتُوا۟ وَهُمْ كُفَّارٌ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ عَلَيْهِمْ لَعْنَةُ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ أَجْمَعِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	 upon	 those	who	 disbelieved,	and	 died	as	 disbelievers,	is	 the	 curse	 of	Allah and	 of	 the	
angels	and	of	men	combined.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Beshak	woh	jinhoñ	ne	kufr	kiya	aur	kāfir	hi	mare	un	par	la'nat	hai	Allah	aur	uske	Farishtoñ	aur	
ādmiyoñ	sab	ki

arabicText: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۖ لَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ وَلَا هُمْ يُنظَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	will	remain	in	it	forever;	neither	will	the	punishment	be	lightened	for	them,	nor	will	they	
be	given	respite.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hamesha	raheñ	ge	us	meiñ	na	un	par	se	azāb	halka	ho	aur	na	unheiñ	mohlat	di	jāye

arabicText: وَإِلَـٰهُكُمْ إِلَـٰهٌۭ وَٰحِدٌۭ ۖ لَّآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
englishTranslationText: Your	God	is	One	God;	there	is	no	God	except	Him	- the	Most	Gracious,	the	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhāra	Ma'bood	ek	Ma'bood	hai	uske	siwa	koi	Ma'bood	nahi	magar	wohi	badi	rahmat	wāla	
maherbān

arabicText: إِنَّ فِى خَلْقِ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَٱخْتِلَـٰفِ ٱلَّيْلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ وَٱلْفُلْكِ ٱلَّتِى تَجْرِى فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ بِمَا يَنفَعُ ٱلنَّاسَ وَمَآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مِن مَّآءٍۢ فَأَحْيَا بِهِ ٱلْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا وَبَثَّ فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ دَآبَّةٍۢ وَتَصْرِيفِ ٱلرِّيَـٰحِ وَٱلسَّحَابِ ٱلْمُسَخَّرِ بَيْنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّقَوْمٍۢ يَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	in	the	creation	of	the	heavens	and	
the	 earth,	 and	 in	 the	 continuous	
alternation	of	night	and	day,	and	the	ships	
which	sail	the	seas	carrying	what	is	of	use	
to	men,	and	 the	water	which	Allah sends	
down	 from	 the	 sky	 thereby	 reviving	 the	
dead	 earth	 and dispersing	 all	 kinds	 of	
beasts	 in	 it,	 and	 the	 movement	 of	 the	
winds,	 and	 the	 obedient	 clouds	 between	
heaven	 and	 earth	 - certainly	 in	 all	 these	
are	signs	for	the	intelligent.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Beshak	 āsmānoñ	 aur	 zameen	 ki	 paidāish	
aur	rāt	o	din	ka	badalte	āana	aur	kashti	ke	
darya	 meiñ	 logoñ	 ke	 fāyede	 lekar	 chalti	
hai	 aur	 woh jo	 Allah	 ne	 āsmān	 se	 pāni	
utār	kar	murda	zameen	ko	us	se	jila	diya	
aur	 zameen	 meiñ	 har	 qism	 ke	 Jānwar	
phailāye	 aur	 hawaoñ	 ki	 gardish	 aur	 woh	
bādal	ke	āasmān-o-zameen	ke	beech	meiñ	
hukm	 ka	 bāñdha	 hai	 in	 sab	 meiñ	 aqlmandoñ	ke	liye	zaroor	nishāniyāñ	haiñ

arabicText: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يَتَّخِذُ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَندَادًۭا يُحِبُّونَهُمْ كَحُبِّ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ أَشَدُّ حُبًّۭا لِّلَّهِ ۗ وَلَوْ يَرَى ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ إِذْ يَرَوْنَ ٱلْعَذَابَ أَنَّ ٱلْقُوَّةَ لِلَّهِ جَمِيعًۭا وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعَذَابِ
englishTranslationText:
And	 some	 people	 create	 for	 themselves	
Gods	(objects	of	worship)	other	than	Allah,	
with	devotion	(love)	equal	to	the	devotion	
of	 Allah;	 and	 the	 believers	 do	 not	 love	
anybody	 with	 love	 equal	 to	 the	 love	 of	
Allah;	 and	what	will	 be	 their	 state,	when	
the	punishment	will	be	before	the	eyes	of	
the	 unjust	 (disbelievers)?	 For	 all	 power	
belongs wholly	 to	 Allah,	 and	 because	
Allah’s	punishment	is	very	severe
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 kuch	 log	 Allah	 ke	 siwa	 aur	 ma'bood	
bana	 lete	 haiñ	 ke	 unheiñ	 Allah	 ki	 tarah	
mehboob rakhte	haiñ	aur	 Imān	wāloñ	 ko	
Allah	 ke	 barābar	 kisi	 ki	 mohabbat	 nahi	
aur	kaisi	ho	agar	dekheiñ	zālim	woh	waqt	
jab	ki	'azāb	unki	ānkhoñ	ke	sāmne	āye	ga	
is	liye	ke	sāra	zor Khuda	ko	hai	aur	is	liye	
ke	Allah	ka	azāb	bahut	sakht	hai

arabicText: إِذْ تَبَرَّأَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتُّبِعُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّبَعُوا۟ وَرَأَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ وَتَقَطَّعَتْ بِهِمُ ٱلْأَسْبَابُ
englishTranslationText:
(The	 day)	 when	 the	 leaders	 will	 be	
disgusted	with	 their	 followers	- and	 they	
shall	 see	 their	 punishment,	 and	 all	 their	
links	will	be	cut	off.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	bezār	hoñge	peshwa	apne	pairwoñ	se	
aur	dekheñge	azāb	aur	kat	jāyeñgi	un	sab	
ki	doreiñ.

arabicText: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّبَعُوا۟ لَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةًۭ فَنَتَبَرَّأَ مِنْهُمْ كَمَا تَبَرَّءُوا۟ مِنَّا ۗ كَذَٰلِكَ يُرِيهِمُ ٱللَّهُ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ حَسَرَٰتٍ عَلَيْهِمْ ۖ وَمَا هُم بِخَـٰرِجِينَ مِنَ ٱلنَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	 followers	will	say,	“If	we	were	to	
return	(to	earth),	we	would	break	off	from	
them	like	 they	 have	 broken	 off	 from	 us”;	
this	 is	 how	 Allah will	 show	 them	 their	
deeds	as	despair	for	them;	and	they	will	never	come	out	from	the	fire	(hell).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kaheñge	pairao	kāsh	hameiñ	laut	kar	
jāna	hota	 (duniya	meiñ)	 to	ham	unse	 tod	
(Juda	ho	jāte)	dete	jaise	unhoñ	ne	ham	se	
tod	 di	 yooñ	 hi	 Allah	 unheiñ	 dikhāye	 ga	
unke	kām	un	par	hasrateiñ	hokar	aur	woh	dozakh	se	nikalne	wāle	nahi

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ كُلُوا۟ مِمَّا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ حَلَـٰلًۭا طَيِّبًۭا وَلَا تَتَّبِعُوا۟ خُطُوَٰتِ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ لَكُمْ عَدُوٌّۭ مُّبِينٌ
englishTranslationText:
O	mankind!	Eat	 from	what	is	lawful	and	clean	in	 the	earth; and	do	not	 follow	 the	 footsteps	of	
the	devil;	undoubtedly	he	is	your	open	enemy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	logoñ! Khao	jo	 kuch	zameen	meiñ	 halāl	 pākizah	 hai	aur	 shaitān	 ke	 qadam	 par	 qadam	 na	
rakho	beshak	woh	tumhāra	khula	dushman	hai

arabicText: إِنَّمَا يَأْمُرُكُم بِٱلسُّوٓءِ وَٱلْفَحْشَآءِ وَأَن تَقُولُوا۟ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
For	he	will	only	instruct	you	towards	the	evil	and	the	shameful,	and	that	you	fabricate	matters	
concerning	Allah,	what	you	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	to	tumheiñ	yahi	hukm	dega	badi	aur	be-hayāi	ka	aur	yeh	ke	Allah	par	woh	bāt	jodo	jiski	
tumheiñ	khabar	nahi

arabicText: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱتَّبِعُوا۟ مَآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ قَالُوا۟ بَلْ نَتَّبِعُ مَآ أَلْفَيْنَا عَلَيْهِ ءَابَآءَنَآ ۗ أَوَلَوْ كَانَ ءَابَآؤُهُمْ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ شَيْـًۭٔا وَلَا يَهْتَدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	it	is	said	to	them,	“Follow	what	
Allah has	 sent	 down”,	 they	 say,	 “On	 the	
contrary,	 we	 shall	 follow	 what	 we	 found	
our	forefathers	upon”;	What!	Even	if	their	
forefathers	 had	 no	 intelligence,	 or	
guidance?!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	unse	kaha	jāye	Allah	ke	utāre	par	
chalo	 to	 kaheñ	 balke	 ham	 to	 us	 par	
chaleñge	 jis	 par	 apne	 bāp	 dāda	 ko	 pāya,
kya	 agarche	 unke	 bāp	 dāda	 na	 kuchh	 aql	
rakhte	hoñ	na	hidāyat

arabicText: وَمَثَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ كَمَثَلِ ٱلَّذِى يَنْعِقُ بِمَا لَا يَسْمَعُ إِلَّا دُعَآءًۭ وَنِدَآءًۭ ۚ صُمٌّۢ بُكْمٌ عُمْىٌۭ فَهُمْ لَا يَعْقِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 the	 example	 of	 the	 disbelievers	 is	
similar	 to	 one	 who	 calls	 upon	 one	 that	
hears	 nothing	 except	 screaming	 and	
yelling;	deaf,	dumb,	blind	- so	they	do	not	
have	sense
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 kāfiroñ	 ki	 kahāwat	 us	 ki	 si	 hai	 jo	
pukāre	 aise	 ko	 ke	 khāli	 cheekh	 pukār	 ke	
siwa	kuch	na	sune	behre	gooñge	andhe, to	
unheiñ	samjh	nahi

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ كُلُوا۟ مِن طَيِّبَـٰتِ مَا رَزَقْنَـٰكُمْ وَٱشْكُرُوا۟ لِلَّهِ إِن كُنتُمْ إِيَّاهُ تَعْبُدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
O	 People	 who	 Believe!	 Eat	 of	 the	 good	
things	 We	 have	 provided	 you,	 and	 be	
grateful	 to	 Allah if	 it	 is	 only	 Him	 you	
worship.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 Imān	 wālo	 khao	 hamāri	 di	 huwi	
suthri	 cheezeñ	 Aur	 Allah	 ka	 ehsān	 māno	
agar	tum	usi	ko	poojte	ho

arabicText: إِنَّمَا حَرَّمَ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْمَيْتَةَ وَٱلدَّمَ وَلَحْمَ ٱلْخِنزِيرِ وَمَآ أُهِلَّ بِهِۦ لِغَيْرِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ فَمَنِ ٱضْطُرَّ غَيْرَ بَاغٍۢ وَلَا عَادٍۢ فَلَآ إِثْمَ عَلَيْهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
He	has	forbidden	for	you	only	the	carrion,	
and	 blood,	 and	 flesh	 of	 swine,	 and	 the	
animal	 that	 has	 been	 slaughtered	 while	
proclaiming	 the	 name	 of	 anyone	 other	
than	Allah;	so	there	is	no	sin	on	him	who	
is	 compelled	 and	 does	 not	 eat	 out	 of	
desire,	 nor	 eats	 more	 than	 what	 is	
necessary;	 indeed	 Allah is	 Oft	 Forgiving,	
Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Usne	 yahi	 tum	 par	 harām	 kiye	 haiñ	
murdār	aur	khoon	aur	suwar	ka	gosht	aur	
woh	 jānwar	 jo	 ghair-e-khuda	 ka	 name	
lekar	 zibah	 kiya	 gaya	 to	jo	 na-chār	 ho	 ya	
yuñ	 ke	 khuwahish	 se	 khāye	 aur	 na	 yooñ	
ke	zaroorat	se	āge	badhe	to	us	par	gunah	
nahi	 beshak	 Allah	 bakhsh	 ne	 wāla	
maherbān	hai.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَكْتُمُونَ مَآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَيَشْتَرُونَ بِهِۦ ثَمَنًۭا قَلِيلًا ۙ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ مَا يَأْكُلُونَ فِى بُطُونِهِمْ إِلَّا ٱلنَّارَ وَلَا يُكَلِّمُهُمُ ٱللَّهُ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ وَلَا يُزَكِّيهِمْ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
englishTranslationText:
Those	 who	 hide	 the	 Book	 sent	 down	 by	
Allah and	exchange	it	for	an	abject	price	-
they	 only	 fill	 their	 bellies	 with	 fire	 and	
Allah will	not	speak	to	them	on	the	Day	of	
Resurrection	nor	will	He	purify	them;	and	for	them	is	a	painful	punishment
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	 jo	 chupāte	 haiñ	 Allah	 ki	 utāri	 kitāb	
aur	 uske	 badle	 zaleel	 qeemat	le	lete	 haiñ	
woh	apne	pet	meiñ	āag	hi	bharte	haiñ	aur	
Allah	Qayāmat	ke	din	unse	bāt	na	karega	aur	na	unheiñ	suthra	kare	aur	unke	liye	dard-nāk	azāb	
hai

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱشْتَرَوُا۟ ٱلضَّلَـٰلَةَ بِٱلْهُدَىٰ وَٱلْعَذَابَ بِٱلْمَغْفِرَةِ ۚ فَمَآ أَصْبَرَهُمْ عَلَى ٱلنَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
They	are	the	people	who	purchased	error	in	exchange	of	guidance,	and	torment	in	exchange	of	
pardon;	so	how	much	can	they	bear	the	fire?
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Woh	log	 haiñ	jinhoñ	 ne	 hidāyat	 ke	 badle	 gumrahi	mol	li	Aur	 bakhshish	 ke	 badle	 ‘azāb	 to	 kis	
darja	unheiñ	āag	ki	sahār (bardāsht) hai

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ نَزَّلَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۗ وَإِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱخْتَلَفُوا۟ فِى ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ لَفِى شِقَاقٍۭ بَعِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
This	 is	 because	Allah has	 sent	 down	 the	 Book	 with	 the	 truth;	 and	 indeed	 those	 who	 caused	
disagreement	in	the	Book	are,	surely,	disputants	in	the	extreme.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	is	liye	ke	Allah	ne	kitāb	haq	ke	sāth	utāri	aur	beshak	jo	log	kitāb	meiñ	ikhtilāf	dālne	lage	
woh	zaroor	parle	sire	ke	jhagdālu	haiñ

arabicText: ۞ لَّيْسَ ٱلْبِرَّ أَن تُوَلُّوا۟ وُجُوهَكُمْ قِبَلَ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱلْبِرَّ مَنْ ءَامَنَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلْيَوْمِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرِ وَٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ وَٱلْكِتَـٰبِ وَٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ وَءَاتَى ٱلْمَالَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ ذَوِى ٱلْقُرْبَىٰ وَٱلْيَتَـٰمَىٰ وَٱلْمَسَـٰكِينَ وَٱبْنَ ٱلسَّبِيلِ وَٱلسَّآئِلِينَ وَفِى ٱلرِّقَابِ وَأَقَامَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتَى ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَٱلْمُوفُونَ بِعَهْدِهِمْ إِذَا عَـٰهَدُوا۟ ۖ وَٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ فِى ٱلْبَأْسَآءِ وَٱلضَّرَّآءِ وَحِينَ ٱلْبَأْسِ ۗ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ صَدَقُوا۟ ۖ وَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Basic	virtue	is	not	just	to	turn	faces	to	the	
East	and	the	West,	but	true	righteousness	
is	 that	 one	must	 believe	in	Allah and	 the	
Last	Day	and	the	angels	and	the	Book	and	
the	Prophets;	and	out	of	love	for	Allah,	to	
give	 treasured	 wealth	 to	 relatives	 and	 to
the	 orphans	 and	 the	 needy	 and	 the	
traveller,	and	to	those	who	ask,	and	to	set	
slaves	 free;	 and	 to	 keep	 the	 prayer	
established	 and	 to	 pay	 the	 charity;	 and	
those	 who	 fulfil	 their	 obligations	 when	
they	make	an	agreement;	and	 the	patient	
during	times	of	calamity,	in	hardships	and	
during	 holy	 war;	 it	 is	 they	 who	 have	
proved	 true	 to	 their	word;	it	is	 they	who	
are	the	pious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Kuch	asl	neki	yeh	nahi	ke	mooñh	mashriq	
ya	maghrib	ki	 taraf	karo	hāñ	asl	neki	yeh	
ke	 Imān	 lāye	 Allah	 aur	 Qayāmat	 aur	
Firishtoñ	aur	Kitāb	aur	Paighambaroñ	par	
aur	 Allah	 ki	 mohabbat	 meiñ	 apna	 azeez	
māl	 de	 risht-e-dāroñ	 aur	 yateemoñ	 aur	
miskeenoñ	aur	rāh-geer	aur	sāiloñ	ko	aur	
gardaneñ	chhudāne	meiñ	aur	namāz	qāim	
rakhe	 aur	 zakāt	 de	 aur	 apna	 qaul	 poora	
karne	wāle	jab	ahed	kareiñ	aur	sabr	wāle	
musibat	 aur	 sakhti	 meiñ	 aur	 jihād	 ke	
waqt,	yehi	haiñ	jinhoñ	ne	apni	bāt	sachhi	
ki	aur	yehi	parhez-gār	haiñ.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ كُتِبَ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلْقِصَاصُ فِى ٱلْقَتْلَى ۖ ٱلْحُرُّ بِٱلْحُرِّ وَٱلْعَبْدُ بِٱلْعَبْدِ وَٱلْأُنثَىٰ بِٱلْأُنثَىٰ ۚ فَمَنْ عُفِىَ لَهُۥ مِنْ أَخِيهِ شَىْءٌۭ فَٱتِّبَاعٌۢ بِٱلْمَعْرُوفِ وَأَدَآءٌ إِلَيْهِ بِإِحْسَـٰنٍۢ ۗ ذَٰلِكَ تَخْفِيفٌۭ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ وَرَحْمَةٌۭ ۗ فَمَنِ ٱعْتَدَىٰ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ فَلَهُۥ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
O	 People	 who	 Believe!	 Retribution	 is	
made	 obligatory	 for	 you	in	 the	matter	 of	
those	 killed	 unjustly;	 a	 freeman	 for	 a	
freeman,	 and	 a	 slave	 for	 a	 slave,	 and	 a	
female	 for	 a	 female;	 and	 for	 him	 who	 is	
partly	 forgiven	 by	 his	 brother,	 seek	
compensation	 with	 courtesy	 and	 make	
payment	in	proper	manner;	this	is	a	relief	
and	a	mercy	upon	you,	from	your	Lord;	so	
after	 this,	 a	 painful	 punishment	 is	 for	
whoever	exceeds	the	limits
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	Imān	wālo!	Tum	par	farz	hai	ke	jo	nahaq	 māre	 jāyeñ	 unke	 khoon	 ka	 badla	 lo	
azād	 ke	 badle	 azād	 aur	 ghulām	 ke	 badle	
ghulām	 aur	 aurat	 ke	 badle	 aurat	 to	 jiske	
liye	 uske	 bhai	 ki	 taraf	 se	 kuchh	 mu'āfi	
huwi	 to	 bhalāi	 se	 taqāza	 ho	 aur	 achhi	
tarah	 ada	 yeh	 tumhāre	 rab	 ki	 taraf	 se	
tumhāra	bojh	halka	karna	hai	aur	tum	par	
rahmat	to	uske	b’ad	jo	ziyadati	kare	uske	
liye	dard-nāk	azāb	hai.

arabicText: وَلَكُمْ فِى ٱلْقِصَاصِ حَيَوٰةٌۭ يَـٰٓأُو۟لِى ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 there	is	life	 for	 you	in	 retribution,	O	
men	 of	 understanding,	 so	 that	 you	 may	
avoid.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 khoon	 ka	 badla	 lene	 meiñ	 tumhāri	
zindagi	 hai	 aey	 aql-mandoñ	 ke	 tum	
kaheeñ	bachho

arabicText: كُتِبَ عَلَيْكُمْ إِذَا حَضَرَ أَحَدَكُمُ ٱلْمَوْتُ إِن تَرَكَ خَيْرًا ٱلْوَصِيَّةُ لِلْوَٰلِدَيْنِ وَٱلْأَقْرَبِينَ بِٱلْمَعْرُوفِ ۖ حَقًّا عَلَى ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	ordained	for	you	that	when	death	approaches	one	of	you,	and	he	leaves	behind	wealth,	he	
must	bequeath	it	to	parents	and	near	relatives	in	accordance	with	tradition;	this	is	a	duty	upon	
the	pious.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	par	farz	huwa	ke	jab	tum	meiñ	kisi	ko	maut	āaye	agar	kuch	māl	chhode	to	wasiyat	kar jāye	
apne	 māñ	 bāp	 aur	 qareeb	 ke	 risht-e-dāroñ	 ke	 liye	 mawafiq-e-dastoor	 yeh	 wājib	 hai	 parhezgāroñ	par

arabicText: فَمَنۢ بَدَّلَهُۥ بَعْدَ مَا سَمِعَهُۥ فَإِنَّمَآ إِثْمُهُۥ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ يُبَدِّلُونَهُۥٓ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
So	whoever	 changes	 the	will	after	 he	 has	 heard	it	- its	 sin	is	 only	 upon	 those	who	 change	it;	
indeed	Allah is	the	All	Hearing,	the	All	Knowing
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	jo	wasiyat	ko	sun	suna	kar	badal	de	iska	gunāh	unheiñ	badalne	wāloñ	par	hai	beshak	Allah	
sunta	jānta	hai

arabicText: فَمَنْ خَافَ مِن مُّوصٍۢ جَنَفًا أَوْ إِثْمًۭا فَأَصْلَحَ بَيْنَهُمْ فَلَآ إِثْمَ عَلَيْهِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Then	if	one	 fears	that	the	will	maker	(the	
deceased)	has	done	injustice	or	sin,	and	he	
makes	 a	 reconciliation	 between	 the	
parties,	 there	 shall	 be	 no	 sin	 upon	 him;	
indeed	 Allah is	 Oft	 Forgiving,	 Most	
Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Phir	jise	andesha	 huwa	 ke	wasiyat	 karne	
wāle	 ne	 kuchh	 be-insāfi	 ya	gunah	 kiya	 to	
usne	 un	 meiñ	 sulah	 kardi	 us	 par	 kuchh	
gunah	 nahi	 beshak	 Allah	 bakhsh	 ne	 wāla	
maherbān	hai

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ كُتِبَ عَلَيْكُمُ ٱلصِّيَامُ كَمَا كُتِبَ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. O	 People	 who	 Believe!	 Fasting	 is	 made	
compulsory	 for	 you,	 like	 it	 was	 ordained	
for	 those	 before	 you,	 so	 that	 you	 may	
attain	piety.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	 Imān	 wālo	 tum	 par	 roze	 farz	 kiye	
gaye	 jaise	 agloñ	 par	 farz	 kiye	 farz	 huwe	
they	ke	kaheeñ	tumheñ	parhez-gāri	mile

arabicText: أَيَّامًۭا مَّعْدُودَٰتٍۢ ۚ فَمَن كَانَ مِنكُم مَّرِيضًا أَوْ عَلَىٰ سَفَرٍۢ فَعِدَّةٌۭ مِّنْ أَيَّامٍ أُخَرَ ۚ وَعَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ يُطِيقُونَهُۥ فِدْيَةٌۭ طَعَامُ مِسْكِينٍۢ ۖ فَمَن تَطَوَّعَ خَيْرًۭا فَهُوَ خَيْرٌۭ لَّهُۥ ۚ وَأَن تَصُومُوا۟ خَيْرٌۭ لَّكُمْ ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
For	 a	 certain	 number	 of	 days	 only;	 so	
whoever	 is	 sick	 among	 you,	 or	 on	 a	
journey,	 the	 same	 number	in	 other	 days;	
and	 those	 who	 do	 not	 have	 the	 strength	
for	it	must	give	a redemption	by	feeding	a	
needy	 person;	 so	 whoever	 increases	 the	
good	 of	 his	 own	 accord,	 it	 is	 better	 for	
him;	 and	 fasting	is	 better	 for	 you,	if	 only	
you	realise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ginti	ke	din	haiñ	to	tum	meiñ	jo	koi	bimār	
ya	 safar	 meiñ	 ho	 to	 utne	 roze	 aur	 dinoñ	
meiñ	 aur	 jinheiñ	 is	 ki	 tāqat	 na	 ho	 woh	
badla	 deñ	 ek	 miskeen ka	 khāna	 phir	 jo	
apni	 taraf	 se	 neki	 ziyada	 kare	 to	 woh	 us	
ke	 liye	 behtar	 hai	 aur	 roza	 rakhna	
tumhāre	 liye	 ziyāda	 bhala	 hai	 agar	 tum	
jāno

arabicText: شَهْرُ رَمَضَانَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أُنزِلَ فِيهِ ٱلْقُرْءَانُ هُدًۭى لِّلنَّاسِ وَبَيِّنَـٰتٍۢ مِّنَ ٱلْهُدَىٰ وَٱلْفُرْقَانِ ۚ فَمَن شَهِدَ مِنكُمُ ٱلشَّهْرَ فَلْيَصُمْهُ ۖ وَمَن كَانَ مَرِيضًا أَوْ عَلَىٰ سَفَرٍۢ فَعِدَّةٌۭ مِّنْ أَيَّامٍ أُخَرَ ۗ يُرِيدُ ٱللَّهُ بِكُمُ ٱلْيُسْرَ وَلَا يُرِيدُ بِكُمُ ٱلْعُسْرَ وَلِتُكْمِلُوا۟ ٱلْعِدَّةَ وَلِتُكَبِّرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ مَا هَدَىٰكُمْ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
The	month	of	Ramadan	in	which	was	sent	
down	 the	 Qur’an	 - the	 guidance	 for	
mankind,	 the	 direction	 and	 the	 clear	
criteria	 (to	 judge	 between	 right	 and	
wrong);	so	whoever	among	you	witnesses	
this	 month,	 must	 fast	 for	 the	 (whole)	
month;	 and	 whoever	 is	 sick	 or	 on	 a	
journey,	may	fast	the	same	number	in	other	days;	Allah desires	ease	for	you	and	does	not	desire	
hardship	 for	 you	- so	 that	 you	 complete	 the	 count	(of	fasts),	 and	glorify	Allah’s	greatness	 for	
having	guided	you,	and	so	that	you	may	be	grateful
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ramzan	 ka	 mahina	 jis	 meiñ	 Qur'ān	 utra	
logoñ	 ke	liye	 hidāyat	aur	 rahnumāi	aur	 faisle	 ki	 raushn	 bāteiñ	 to	 tum	meiñ	jo	 koi	 ye	mahina	
pāye	zaroor	iske	roze	rakhe	aur	jo	bimār	ya	safar	meiñ	ho	to	itne	roze	aur	dinoñ	meiñ	Allah	tum	
par	asāni	chāhta	hai	aur	 tum	par	dushwāri	nahi	chāhta	aur	isliye	ke	 tum	ginti	poori	karo	aur	
Allah	ki	badāi	bolo	is	par	ke	usne	tumheñ	hidāyat	ki	aur	kaheeñ	tum	haq	guzār	ho.

arabicText: وَإِذَا سَأَلَكَ عِبَادِى عَنِّى فَإِنِّى قَرِيبٌ ۖ أُجِيبُ دَعْوَةَ ٱلدَّاعِ إِذَا دَعَانِ ۖ فَلْيَسْتَجِيبُوا۟ لِى وَلْيُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِى لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْشُدُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 O	 dear	 Prophet	 (Muhammad - peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him),	 when	 My	 bondmen	
question	you	concerning	Me,	then	surely	I	am	close;	I	answer	the	prayer	of	the	supplicant	when	
he	calls	on	Me,	so	they	must	obey	Me	and	believe	in	Me,	so	that	they	may	attain	guidance.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 aey	Mehboob jab	 tum	 se	 mere	 bande	 mujhe	 poocheñ	 to	 maiñ	 nazdeek	 hooñ	 dua	 qubool	
karta	hooñ	pukār	ne	wāle	ki	jab	mujhe	pukāre	to	unheiñ	chāhiye	mera	hukm	māneñ	aur	mujh	
par	Imān	lāyeñ	ke	kaheeñ	rāh	pāyeñ

arabicText: أُحِلَّ لَكُمْ لَيْلَةَ ٱلصِّيَامِ ٱلرَّفَثُ إِلَىٰ نِسَآئِكُمْ ۚ هُنَّ لِبَاسٌۭ لَّكُمْ وَأَنتُمْ لِبَاسٌۭ لَّهُنَّ ۗ عَلِمَ ٱللَّهُ أَنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَخْتَانُونَ أَنفُسَكُمْ فَتَابَ عَلَيْكُمْ وَعَفَا عَنكُمْ ۖ فَٱلْـَٔـٰنَ بَـٰشِرُوهُنَّ وَٱبْتَغُوا۟ مَا كَتَبَ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمْ ۚ وَكُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يَتَبَيَّنَ لَكُمُ ٱلْخَيْطُ ٱلْأَبْيَضُ مِنَ ٱلْخَيْطِ ٱلْأَسْوَدِ مِنَ ٱلْفَجْرِ ۖ ثُمَّ أَتِمُّوا۟ ٱلصِّيَامَ إِلَى ٱلَّيْلِ ۚ وَلَا تُبَـٰشِرُوهُنَّ وَأَنتُمْ عَـٰكِفُونَ فِى ٱلْمَسَـٰجِدِ ۗ تِلْكَ حُدُودُ ٱللَّهِ فَلَا تَقْرَبُوهَا ۗ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ ٱللَّهُ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَتَّقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. Going	 to	 your	 wives	 during	 the	 nights	 of	
the	 fast	 is	 made	 lawful	 for	 you;	 they	 are	
coverings	 for	 you	 and	 you	 are	 coverings	
for	 them;	 Allah knows	 that	 you	 were	
deceiving	 yourselves	 (in	 this	 respect),	 so	
He	 accepted	 your	 penance	 and	 forgave	
you;	so	cohabit	with	 them	and	seek	what	
Allah has	 destined	 for	 you	- and	 eat	 and	
drink	 until	 the	 white	 thread	 becomes	
distinct	 to	 you	 from	 the	 black	 thread	 at	
dawn	 - then	 complete	 the	 fast	 till	
nightfall;	 and	 do	 not	 touch	 women	 while	
staying	 in	 seclusion	 for	 worship	 in	 the	
masjids;	 these	 are	 the	 limits	 imposed	 by	
Allah,	so	do	not	go	near	them;	this	is	how	
Allah explains	 His	 verses	 to	 mankind	 so	
that	they	may	attain	piety.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Rozoñ	 ki	 rātoñ	 meiñ	 apni	 aurtoñ	 ke	 pās	
jāna	 tumhāre	 liye	 halāl	 huwa	 woh	
tumhāri	libās	haiñ	aur	tum	unke	jānoñ	ko	
khayanat	meiñ	dālte	they	to	usne	tumhāri	
tauba	 qabool	 ki	 aur	 tumheiñ	 mu'āf	
farmāya	 to	ab	unse	sohbat	karo	aur	 talab	
karo	 jo	 Allah	 ne	 tumhāre	 naseeb	 meiñ	
likha	 ho	 aur	 khāo	 aur	 piyo	 yahāñ	 tak	 ke	
tumhāre	liye	zāhir	ho	jāye	safedi	ka	dora	
siyāhi	 ke	 dore	 se	 (pau	 phat	 kar)	 phir	 rāt	
āne	 tak	 roze	 poore	 karo	 aur	 aurtoñ	 ko	
hāth	 na	 lagāo	 jab	 tum	 Masjidoñ	 meiñ	
a'itekāf	 se	 ho	 yeh	 Allah	 ki	 hadeiñ	 haiñ	
unke	pās	na	jao	Allah	yooñ	hi	bayān	kar	ta	
hai	 logoñ	 se	 apni	 āyateiñ	 ke	 kaheeñ	
unheiñ	parhez-gāri	mile.

arabicText: وَلَا تَأْكُلُوٓا۟ أَمْوَٰلَكُم بَيْنَكُم بِٱلْبَـٰطِلِ وَتُدْلُوا۟ بِهَآ إِلَى ٱلْحُكَّامِ لِتَأْكُلُوا۟ فَرِيقًۭا مِّنْ أَمْوَٰلِ ٱلنَّاسِ بِٱلْإِثْمِ وَأَنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 do	 not	 unjustly	 devour	 the	 property	
of	 each	 other,	 nor	 take	 their	 cases	 to	
judges	 in	 order	 that	 you	 may	 wrongfully	
devour	 a	 portion	 of	 other	 peoples’	
property	on	purpose.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 āpas	 meiñ	 ek	 doosre	 ka	 māl	 na-haq	
na	 khāo	 aur	 na	 hākimoñ	 ke	 pās	 unka	
muqaddama	isliye	pahuñchao	ke	logoñ	ka	
kuch	māl	na-jāiz	taur	par	kha	lo	jān	boojh	
kar

arabicText: ۞ يَسْـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلْأَهِلَّةِ ۖ قُلْ هِىَ مَوَٰقِيتُ لِلنَّاسِ وَٱلْحَجِّ ۗ وَلَيْسَ ٱلْبِرُّ بِأَن تَأْتُوا۟ ٱلْبُيُوتَ مِن ظُهُورِهَا وَلَـٰكِنَّ ٱلْبِرَّ مَنِ ٱتَّقَىٰ ۗ وَأْتُوا۟ ٱلْبُيُوتَ مِنْ أَبْوَٰبِهَا ۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	ask	you,	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad
- peace	 and	 blessings	 be	 upon	 him),	
regarding	 the	 crescents;	 say,	 “They	 are	
indicators	 of	 time	 for	 mankind	 and	 for	
Hajj	 (the	 pilgrimage)”;	 and	 it	 is	 not	 a	
virtue	at	all	 that	 you	enter	 the	houses	by	
demolishing	their	back	portions,	but	in	reality	virtue	is	piety;	and	enter	the	houses	using	their	
gates	- and	keep	fearing	Allah,	hoping	that	you	achieve	success.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	se	naye	chāñd	ko	poochte	haiñ	farmā	
do	woh	waqt	ki	alāmateiñ	haiñ	logoñ	aur	
haj	 ke	 liye	 aur	 yeh	 kuchh	 bhalāi	 nahi	 ke	
gharoñ	meiñ	pacheet (makān	 ke	peeche	 ki	diwār)	 tord	 kar	āao,	hāñ	bhalāi	 to	parhez-gāri	hai	
aur	gharoñ	meiñ	darwāzoñ	se	āao	aur	Allah	se	darte	raho	is	ummid	par	ke	falāh	pāo.

arabicText: وَقَـٰتِلُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّذِينَ يُقَـٰتِلُونَكُمْ وَلَا تَعْتَدُوٓا۟ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُعْتَدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 fight	in	Allah's	cause	against	 those	who	 fight	you	and	do	not	exceed	 the	limits;	and	Allah
does	not	like	the	transgressors.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Allah	 ki	 rāh	meiñ	lado	 unse	jo	 tum	 se	ladte	 haiñ	aur	 had	 se	 na	 badho	Allah	 pasand	 nahi	
rakhta	had	se	badhne	wāloñ	ko.

arabicText: وَٱقْتُلُوهُمْ حَيْثُ ثَقِفْتُمُوهُمْ وَأَخْرِجُوهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ أَخْرَجُوكُمْ ۚ وَٱلْفِتْنَةُ أَشَدُّ مِنَ ٱلْقَتْلِ ۚ وَلَا تُقَـٰتِلُوهُمْ عِندَ ٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْحَرَامِ حَتَّىٰ يُقَـٰتِلُوكُمْ فِيهِ ۖ فَإِن قَـٰتَلُوكُمْ فَٱقْتُلُوهُمْ ۗ كَذَٰلِكَ جَزَآءُ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 slay	 the	 disbelievers	 wherever	 you	
find	them,	and	drive	them	out	from	where	
they	 drove	 you	 out,	and	 the	 turmoil	 they	
cause	 is	 worse	 than	 slaying;	 and	 do	 not	
fight	 them	 near	 the	 Sacred	 Masjid until	
they	 fight	 you	 there;	 so	if	 they	 fight	 you,	
slay	 them;	 this	 is	 the	 punishment	 of	 the	
disbelievers
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kāfiroñ	ko	jahāñ	pāo	māro	aur	unheiñ	
nikāl	do	jahāñ	se	unhoñ	ne	tumheiñ	nikāla	
tha	aur	unka	fasād	to	qatl	se	bhi	sakht	hai	
aur	 Masjid-e-Harām ke	 pās	 unse	 na	 lado	
jab	tak	 woh	 tum	 se	 wahāñ	 na	 ladeiñ	 aur	
agar	 tum	 se	 ladeiñ	 to	 unheiñ	 qatl	 karo	
kāfiroñ	ki	yahi	saza	hai

arabicText: فَإِنِ ٱنتَهَوْا۟ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Then	 if	 they	 desist,	 then	 indeed	 Allah is	
Oft	Forgiving,	Most	Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	agar	woh	b'az	raheiñ	to	beshak	Allah	
bakhsh	ne	wāla	maherbān	hai

arabicText: وَقَـٰتِلُوهُمْ حَتَّىٰ لَا تَكُونَ فِتْنَةٌۭ وَيَكُونَ ٱلدِّينُ لِلَّهِ ۖ فَإِنِ ٱنتَهَوْا۟ فَلَا عُدْوَٰنَ إِلَّا عَلَى ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	fight	them	until	no	mischief	remains,	
and	only	Allah is	worshipped;	then	if	they	
desist,	 do	 not	 harm	 them,	 except	 the	
unjust.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	 unse	 lado	 yahāñ	 tak	 ke	 koi	 fitna	 na	
rahe	 aur	 ek	 Allah	 ki	 pooja	 ho	 phir	 agar	
woh	 b'az	 āyeiñ	 to	 ziyadati	 nahi	 magar	
zālimoñ	par.

arabicText: ٱلشَّهْرُ ٱلْحَرَامُ بِٱلشَّهْرِ ٱلْحَرَامِ وَٱلْحُرُمَـٰتُ قِصَاصٌۭ ۚ فَمَنِ ٱعْتَدَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَٱعْتَدُوا۟ عَلَيْهِ بِمِثْلِ مَا ٱعْتَدَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ ۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ مَعَ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ
englishTranslationText:
The	 sacred	 month	 for	 the	 sacred	 month,	
and	 respect	 in	 lieu	 of	 respect;	 harm	 the	
one	 who	 harms	 you,	 to	 the	 extent	 as	 he	
did	 - and	 keep	 fearing	 Allah,	 and	 know	
well	that	Allah is	with	the	piou
romanUrduTranslationText:
Māhe	 harām	 ke	 badle	 māhe	 harām	 aur	
adab	 ke	 badle	 adab	 hai	 to	 jo	 tum	 par	
ziyadati	 kare	 tum	 us	 par	 ziyadati	 karo	
utni	hi	jitni	usne	ki	aur	Allah	se	darte	raho	
aur	jān	 rakho	 ke	Allah	dar	wāloñ	 ke	 sāth	
hai

arabicText: وَأَنفِقُوا۟ فِى سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَا تُلْقُوا۟ بِأَيْدِيكُمْ إِلَى ٱلتَّهْلُكَةِ ۛ وَأَحْسِنُوٓا۟ ۛ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	 spend	 your	 wealth	 in	 Allah's	 cause,	
and	 do	 not	 fall	 into	 ruin	 with	 your	 own	
hands;	 and	 be	 virtuous;	 undoubtedly	 the	
righteous	are	the	beloved	of	Allah
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur Allah	 ki	 rāh	 meiñ	 kharch	 karo	 aur	
apne	 hāthoñ	 halākat	 meiñ	 na	 pado	 aur	
bhalāi	 wāle	 ho	 jāo	 beshak	 bhalāi	 wāle	
Allah	ke	mehboob	haiñ

arabicText: وَأَتِمُّوا۟ ٱلْحَجَّ وَٱلْعُمْرَةَ لِلَّهِ ۚ فَإِنْ أُحْصِرْتُمْ فَمَا ٱسْتَيْسَرَ مِنَ ٱلْهَدْىِ ۖ وَلَا تَحْلِقُوا۟ رُءُوسَكُمْ حَتَّىٰ يَبْلُغَ ٱلْهَدْىُ مَحِلَّهُۥ ۚ فَمَن كَانَ مِنكُم مَّرِيضًا أَوْ بِهِۦٓ أَذًۭى مِّن رَّأْسِهِۦ فَفِدْيَةٌۭ مِّن صِيَامٍ أَوْ صَدَقَةٍ أَوْ نُسُكٍۢ ۚ فَإِذَآ أَمِنتُمْ فَمَن تَمَتَّعَ بِٱلْعُمْرَةِ إِلَى ٱلْحَجِّ فَمَا ٱسْتَيْسَرَ مِنَ ٱلْهَدْىِ ۚ فَمَن لَّمْ يَجِدْ فَصِيَامُ ثَلَـٰثَةِ أَيَّامٍۢ فِى ٱلْحَجِّ وَسَبْعَةٍ إِذَا رَجَعْتُمْ ۗ تِلْكَ عَشَرَةٌۭ كَامِلَةٌۭ ۗ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَن لَّمْ يَكُنْ أَهْلُهُۥ حَاضِرِى ٱلْمَسْجِدِ ٱلْحَرَامِ ۚ وَٱتَّقُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ وَٱعْلَمُوٓا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ شَدِيدُ ٱلْعِقَابِ
englishTranslationText:
. And	 perform	 Hajj	 (greater	 pilgrimage)	
and	 Umrah	 (lesser	 pilgrimage)	 for	 Allah;	
and	 if	 you	 are	 prevented,	 send	 sacrifice	
whatever	 is	 available;	 and	 do	 not	 shave	
your	 heads	 until	 the	 sacrifice	 reaches	 its	
destination;	so	whoever	among	you	is	sick	
or	has	an	ailment	in	the	head,	must	pay a	
compensation	 by	 fasting	 or	 charity	 or	
sacrifice;	 then	 when	 you	 are	 in	 peace	 -
and	 whoever	 takes	 the	 advantage	 of	
combining	the	Hajj	and	Umrah,	it	is	compulsory	for	him	to	sacrifice	whatever	is	available;	and	
whoever	cannot	afford	it,	must	fast	for	three days	while	on	the	pilgrimage,	and	seven	when	you	
have	returned	to	your	homes;	these	are	ten	in	all;	this	decree	is	for	him	who	is	not	a	resident	of	
Mecca;	and	keep	fearing	Allah and	know	well	that	Allah’s	punishment	is	severe.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	 Haj aur	 Umrah Allah	 ke	 liye	 poora	
karo	 phir	 agar	 tum	 roke	 jāo	 to	 Qurbani	
bhejo	 jo	 mayassar	 āaye	 aur	 apne	 sar	 na	
mundhāo	jab	tak	Qurbāni	apne	thikāne	na	
pahoñch	 jāye	 phir	 jo	 tum	meiñ	 bimār	 ho	
ya	uske	sar	meiñ	kuch	takleef	hai	to	badla	
de	roze	ya	khairāt	ya	Qurbāni	phir	jab	tum	itmenān	se	ho	to	jo	Haj se	Umrah milāne	ka	faidah	
uthāye	us	par	Qurbāni	hai	jaisi	mayassar	āaye	phir	jise	maqdoor	na	ho	to	teen	roze	Haj	ke	dinoñ	
meiñ	rakhe	aur	sāt	jab	apne	ghar	palat	kar	jāo	yeh	poore	Das	huwe	yeh	hukm	uske	liye	hai	jo	
Makkāh ka	rahne	wāla	na	ho	aur	Allah	se	darte	raho	aur	jān	rakho	ke	Allah	ka	‘azāb	sakht	hai

arabicText: ٱلْحَجُّ أَشْهُرٌۭ مَّعْلُومَـٰتٌۭ ۚ فَمَن فَرَضَ فِيهِنَّ ٱلْحَجَّ فَلَا رَفَثَ وَلَا فُسُوقَ وَلَا جِدَالَ فِى ٱلْحَجِّ ۗ وَمَا تَفْعَلُوا۟ مِنْ خَيْرٍۢ يَعْلَمْهُ ٱللَّهُ ۗ وَتَزَوَّدُوا۟ فَإِنَّ خَيْرَ ٱلزَّادِ ٱلتَّقْوَىٰ ۚ وَٱتَّقُونِ يَـٰٓأُو۟لِى ٱلْأَلْبَـٰبِ
englishTranslationText:
The	 Hajj	 is	 during	 the	 well-known	
months;	 and	 for	 one	 who	 intends	 to	
perform	the	Hajj	in	it	- neither	is	there	to	
be	 mention	 of	 cohabitation	 in	 the	
presence	 of	 women,	 nor	 any	 sin,	 nor	 a	
fight	 with	 anyone	 till	 the	 completion	 of	
Hajj;	 and	 whatever	 good	 you	 do,	 Allah
knows	 it;	 and	 take	 provision	 along	 with	
you	 for	 the	 best	 provision	 is	 piety;	 and	
keep	fearing	Me,	O	men	of	understanding!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Haj	ke	kai	maheene	hai	jāne	huwe	to	jo	un	
meiñ	 Haj	 ki	 niyat	 kare	 to	 na	 aurtoñ	 ke	
sāmne	sohbat	ka	 tazkira	ho	na	koi	gunāh	
na	kisi	se	jhagda	Haj	ke	waqt	tak	aur	tum	
jo	 bhalāi	 karo	 Allah	 use	 jānta	 hai	 aur	
tosha (safar	 ka	 kharch) sāth	lo	 ke	 sab	 se	
behtar	 tosha	 parhez-gāri	 hai	aur	mujh	 se	
darte	raho	aey	aql	wālo

arabicText: لَيْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ جُنَاحٌ أَن تَبْتَغُوا۟ فَضْلًۭا مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ ۚ فَإِذَآ أَفَضْتُم مِّنْ عَرَفَـٰتٍۢ فَٱذْكُرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ عِندَ ٱلْمَشْعَرِ ٱلْحَرَامِ ۖ وَٱذْكُرُوهُ كَمَا هَدَىٰكُمْ وَإِن كُنتُم مِّن قَبْلِهِۦ لَمِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
englishTranslationText:
It	 is	 no	 sin	 for	 you	 that	 you	 seek	 the	
bounty	of	your	Lord;	so	when	you	return	
from	 Arafat,	 remember	 Allah near	 the	
Sacred	 Symbol	(Mash’ar	 al	 Haram)	- and	
remember	 Him	 in	 the	 manner	 He	 has	
guided	 you;	 and	 indeed,	 before	 this,	 you	
were	of	the	astray.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	 par	 koi	 gunāh	 nahi	 ke	 apne	 Rab	 ka	
fazl	 talāsh	 karo	 to	 jab	 arafāt	 se	 palto	 to	
Allah	 ki	 yād	 karo	mash'are	 harām	 ke	pās	
aur	 uska	 zikr	 karo	 jaise	 usne	 tumheiñ	
hidāyat	 farmāyi	 aur	 beshak	 is	 se	 pahle	
tum	bahke	huwe	they

arabicText: ثُمَّ أَفِيضُوا۟ مِنْ حَيْثُ أَفَاضَ ٱلنَّاسُ وَٱسْتَغْفِرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٌۭ رَّحِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
. Then,	 O	 people	 of	 Quraish,	 you	 too	 must	
return	 from	 the	 place	 where	 the	 people	
return	 from,	 and	 ask	 forgiveness	 from	
Allah;	indeed	Allah is	Oft	 Forgiving,	Most	
Merciful.
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Phir	 bāt	 yeh	 hai	 ke	 aey	 Quraishiyo	 tum	
bhi	 wahiñ	 se	 palto	 jahāñ	 se	 log	 palat	 te	
haiñ	aur	Allah	se	mu'āfi	māñgo	beshak	Allah	bakhsh	ne	wāla	maherbān	hai

arabicText: فَإِذَا قَضَيْتُم مَّنَـٰسِكَكُمْ فَٱذْكُرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَذِكْرِكُمْ ءَابَآءَكُمْ أَوْ أَشَدَّ ذِكْرًۭا ۗ فَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يَقُولُ رَبَّنَآ ءَاتِنَا فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا وَمَا لَهُۥ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ مِنْ خَلَـٰقٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
So	 when	 you	 have	 completed	 your	 Hajj	
rites,	 remember	 Allah as	 you	 used	 to	
remember	 your	 forefathers,	in	 fact	more	 than	 that;	and	among	 the	people	are	 some	 that	 say,	
“Our	Lord!	Give	us	in	this	world”	- and	he	does	not	have	a	portion	in	the	Hereafter.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	 apne	Haj ke	 kām	 poore	 kar	 chuko	 to	 Allah	 ka	 zikr	 karo	jaise	 apne	 bāp	 dāda	 ka	 zikr	
karte	 they	 balke	is	 se	ziyada	aur	 koi	ādmi	 yooñ	 kahta	hai	 ke	aey	Rab	hamāre	hameiñ	duniya	
meiñ	de	aur	ākhirat	meiñ	uska	kuchh	hissa	nahi

arabicText: وَمِنْهُم مَّن يَقُولُ رَبَّنَآ ءَاتِنَا فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةًۭ وَفِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ حَسَنَةًۭ وَقِنَا عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
And	 among	 them	 are	 some	 that	 say,	 “Our	 Lord!	 Give	 us	 good	 in	 the	 world	 and	 good	 in	 the	
Hereafter,	and	save	us	from	the	punishment	of	fire!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
. Aur	koi	yooñ	kahta	hai	ke	aey	Rab	hamāre	hameiñ	duniya	meiñ	bhalāi	de	aur	hameiñ	ākhirat	
meiñ	bhalāi	de	aur	hameiñ	‘azāb-e-dozakh	se	bacha.

arabicText: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ لَهُمْ نَصِيبٌۭ مِّمَّا كَسَبُوا۟ ۚ وَٱللَّهُ سَرِيعُ ٱلْحِسَابِ
englishTranslationText: For	such	is	a	portion	from	what	they	have	earned;	and	Allah is	Swift	At	Taking Account.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aisoñ	ko	unki	kamāyi	se	bhāg	hai	aur	Allah	jald	hisāb	karne	wāla	hai.
